page.title: 02LANDSCAPE,NTH.KILWORTH AREA
page.content: This part of South Leicestershire presents a gently rolling aspect. The valleys being about 115m above sea level, rising to hillocks of 165m. The Leicester arm of the{Grand {Union Canal}runs through this section.This keeps to the 123m contour,and is part of the 22 mile long summit section of the canal. The Welford Arm leaves the main line at 627825.The canal swings East as it enters the{Husbands Bosworth Tunnel. {Trees}abound in this area, hedges being generously punctuated with them. There are in addition several areas of woodland,one of which,{North Kilworth {Sticks,}is a{fox}covert. Built into one corner of a staggered cross-roads,is the village of{North Kilworth,}with the church, its oldest building,sharing the high ground with the village school.
